MailCall: ^I walk into the common area, which is currently host to a decently sized gathering of people.
^Max appears to be the center of attention, holding a small stack of envelopes in their hands.

s0: ^Oh, it must be mail call. Max usually does those on weekends.

MailCall: ^, there you are. I'm just doin' a mail call."
^"The front desk has been sitting on these letters for a while. Some people haven't been picking up their mail..."
^Max casts an exasperated look at Eduardo.
^"So I'm just handing them all out now!"
^Max thrusts a heap of letters onto a startled Eduardo. Wow, his mail made up more than 60% of the stack.
^[Eduardo] "Eh, my familia, probably. They are very old fashioned. They have my number. They could just call me."
^[Isaac] "Maybe they don't want to listen to you."
^[Max] "And Isaac, here's yours. They also seem to be from your folks."
^Max hands Isaac about half of the remaining mail.
^"Oh, um... I guess I don't have any mail for you."
^[Charlotte] "That is to be expected. I check the front desk everyday in my routine."
^"Besides, my family hasn't attempted to contact me for some time."
^"Not out of disdain, mind you. There is simply nothing left to say."
^[Trissa] "That's a somber comment to make, Lotty."
^[Trissa] "Eh, nevermind. It's not my place to pry into your personal life."
^[Max] "And Trissa, I've got one letter for you."
^[Trissa] "Really? Is it from my lil' bro Spencer?"
^Trissa cheerily takes the letter and begins immediately tearing it to shreds.
^She walks over the the fireplace and tosses the scraps into the crackling flames.
^Max either does not notice or does not care to comment, and instead continues handing out letters.
^[Max] "Oh, Timothy. This letter from your folks that just came in when I grabbed the mail pile."
^Timothy stares at the envelope, making no attempt to open it before walking away with it in hand.
^He looked a little pale there. I wonder if

b: ^this is the cause for the drama later in the week
^He probably just prefers opening his letters in privacy. Then again...
^The more I think about it the more convinced I am
^Just as I'm about to follow, doubt overwhelms me.

c: ^I decide Timothy is better off with some alone time

IgnorantBliss: ^Most everyone from the second floor has scattered, leaving the regulars lounging around.
MaxMail: ^Before I can do anything, Max strides up to me with a small handful of letters and an eager expression.
^Max's expression fades from anticipation to disappointment.
^[Max] "Oh, well. I suppose your friends and family won't be needing to write you letters anymore anyways."
^"All that's left is tomorrow and you'll be out of here! Isn't that exciting?"
^I force a smile. Why am I not happy about this?
^For some reason Max's words stress me out. @(Increased Stress slightly)
SocialHourOver: ^Well, talking to people has gotten me out of my funk a little at least. @(decreased depression slightly)
^The impromptu social hour seems to die down, as the remaining first-floor residents return to their lives.
TrissaTalk: ^I walk over towards Trissa, who is leaning by the fireplace, with her nose in that book of hers.
^] "Um, Trissa, if you don't mind me asking, what was with the letter you tossed in the fireplace?"
^[Trissa] "Oh, just some garbage that needed express removal. Nothing you ned to worry about."

b: ^] "Well, yeah but, who was it from?"
^[Trissa] "You see, the entirety of my family, save my little bother Spencer, died recently."
^] "Oh. uh, I'm sorry for your loss."
^"They're all fine. No one is physically dead. They're just dead to me."

TrissaTalk: ^, I suppose I wasn't clear, as I do mind talking about the subject."
^[Trissa] "No, it's nothing against you personally. I just have somethings in my past I'd rather not talk about."
^I don't really like talking about my past either, so its only fair @(increased Awareness faintly)
^[Trissa] "Thanks for coming over and chattin' though."
EduardoTalk: ^I walk over to Eduardo, who is rapidly tearing through his pile of letters.
^] "Eduardo are you even reading the letters you got?"

b: ^You know, maybe they wouldn't be old if you actually bothered to pick them up when they arrived.
^] "You know, maybe they wouldn't be old if you actually got them when they got here."
^"You know, check the front desk from time to time?"
^[Eduardo] "Hey, I do check the front desk all the time."
^"I just... <delay=0.5>didn't want to pick them up."
^"Look, the sucky part of familia is you can't approach it at your own pace, its gotta be at their pace."
^"Or at least, my family's like that. I dunno."

EduardoTalk: ^Eduardo gets up, holding only a single letter in his hand.
^"I'mma read this one, since it's the most recent."
^Eduardo opens the first one and begins reading through it.
^His sour mood seems to vanish as he breaks out into a chuckle.
^"I'm just laughing at 'minha mãe.' My mother, she is... quirky."
^When he's done reading he neatly folds the letter into his jacket pocket and starts walking off.
IsaacTalk: ^I walk over to Isaac, neatly sorting his stack of letters.
^He looks as though he is going to open one, but then just places it back down in the stack.
^] "Not sure which one to open first?"
^"Haven't talked them for months. Not since..."
^Isaac mumbles off, looking off to the side. I follow his line of sight, to Eduardo, who is practically shredding through his letters.

b: ^I really don't know where Isaac was going his line of thinking. although, really, thats true for like half the time I'm around him.
^"Actually, they'd be happy. That I found someone."

IsaacTalk: ^[Isaac] "I'm goin' to get some fresh air."
^That was kind of abrupt. Wonder what his deal was?
CharlotteTalk: ^I walk over to Charlotte, who seems to be staring intently at the other residents.

b: ^Uh oh. She looks pissed. What did I-
^<Speed=200%>Oh god, I forgot to meet her for tea!
^"It is quite rude to accept an invitation and then fail to keep the appointment, you know."
^"And to think I was so impressed with your progress..."
^] "I'm so sorry, Charlotte! It just slipped my mind... I..."
^"I made a grave mistake. I didn't mean to hurt you..."
^"Would you accept an honest apology from a forgetful idiot?"
^[Charlotte] "Perhaps you are not as entirely bereft of courtesy as I had surmised."
^"Join me for tea tomorrow at the same time!"
^"Do you think you can manage that,

c: ^] "As much as I'd like to redeem myself... Sorry, but I can't."
^[Charlotte] "Ah, well. I respect a lesson learned."
^"It's wiser to decline an invitation than miss it."

b: ^Uh oh. She looks pissed. What did I-
^<Speed=200%>Oh god, I forgot to meet her in the library!
^"It is quite rude to accept an invitation and then fail to keep the appointment, you know."
^"But I recognize you are no expert at these sorts of things."
^"Ironically, had you not been absent for our meeting I would have passed that information along to you."

CharlotteTalk: ^] "How often did you get letters from your family?"
^"Generally speaking, my parents are the only ones who reach out to me, and they typically do so in person or over the phone."
^"Perhaps it would be different were my family not so close by, as with Eduardo's kin in Brazil."
^"My Grandmother does send me the occasional letter though."
^"I cherish them each time they arrive."
^Charlotte sighs, her eyes wandering off somewhere before returning directly to me.
^, do you think I'm old fashioned?"

b: ^It seems weird to tell her she looks like she came from a Victorian novel, so I don't.
^[Charlotte] "Oh, definitely. Another perspective on myself would be most beneficial."
^I take a moment to breath, before I open the floodgates.
^"You dress like you're from a Victorian novel, @you act more like you work here than you live here, @And in fact I though you did work here for quite a while."
^"You have a very distinctly style of speech which is very different from everyone else's, @And I had a dream that you were a robot once and I always remember that."
^"I suppose I still have much work left to do, until I can return to society proper."

CharlotteTalk: ^[Charlotte] "Well, I suppose I should be off. Best keep to my routine."
ClosedWound: ^With Max gone, I can finally go find Timothy. I'm certain I saw him heading in the direction of our room.

b: ^I arrive at my door and take a deep breath. I feel oddly nervous.
^Having calmed my nerves a bit, I reach for the knob and...
^Oh, right. It's locked. And I still don't have a key.
^How was I expecting this to go?
^] "Timothy? It's me. I uh... don't have my key, remember?"
^I stand there for a few minutes before giving up. Maybe people are still back in the commons.
^If I want to get back into my room, I'm probably going to need to get a key.
^I head out of the hallway and back out into the main room of the house.
